sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
ANCHOR is the foundational phase of the S.A.M. methodology. It identifies the origin points where false premises first emerge in a document corpus‚Äîthe moments when speculation becomes assertion, hearsay becomes evidence, or assumption becomes fact.

Most institutional failures can be traced to specific anchor points: claims that entered the system without adequate verification and subsequently propagated unchecked.

sections.title: Detection Methodology
items: Identify claims presented as fact without supporting evidence
Trace each assertion backward to its earliest documented appearance
Flag statements that transform uncertainty into certainty without justification
Mark hearsay treated as direct evidence
Detect speculation presented as professional opinion

sections.title: Case Example
sections.label: Social Work Assessment
sections.content: Report states "the father has anger management issues" as established fact. Tracing backward reveals this originated from a single unverified allegation in an initial referral, never independently assessed or corroborated, yet adopted by three subsequent professionals.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
INHERIT tracks how claims propagate across institutional boundaries without independent verification. When one agency's assessment is adopted by another without re-evaluation, errors compound and gain apparent authority.

This phase maps the transmission pathways‚Äîidentifying which institutions adopted claims from whom, and whether any verification occurred at each handoff.

sections.title: Detection Methodology
items: Map citation chains across documents and agencies
Identify circular citation patterns (A cites B cites A)
Flag claims adopted without independent verification
Track how language mutates during transmission
Measure the "authority accumulation" at each step

sections.title: Case Example
sections.label: Multi-Agency Investigation
sections.content: Initial police report contains speculative statement. Child protection services quotes it as "police findings." Court welfare officer cites both. By final hearing, the statement appears in 6 documents from 4 agencies, each citing the others‚Äîbut all trace to the same unverified origin.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
COMPOUND documents how claims gain weight through repetition rather than verification‚Äîwhat is termed "authority laundering." A statement repeated by four professionals appears more credible than one stated by a single source, even when all four trace to the same unverified origin.

This phase quantifies how apparent authority accumulates and identifies the tipping points where unverified claims become "established facts."

sections.title: Detection Methodology
items: Count endorsements of each claim across the corpus
Distinguish verification (new evidence) from repetition (same evidence)
Identify "critical mass" points where claims become assumed facts
Measure the ratio of citations to original evidence
Flag claims where authority exceeds evidentiary basis

sections.title: Case Example
sections.label: Expert Report Analysis
sections.content: Court accepts finding as "established" because four professionals stated it. Analysis reveals: Professional A originated the claim without evidence; B, C, and D each cited the previous reports. Authority ratio: 4 endorsements, 0 independent verifications, 1 origin point.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
ARRIVE maps catastrophic outcomes back to their originating false premises, establishing but-for causation: would the outcome have occurred if the anchor claim had been verified?

This phase connects the analytical work of phases 1-3 to real-world consequences, demonstrating how initial errors cascaded into final decisions.

sections.title: Detection Methodology
items: Identify key decision points in the timeline
Map which claims were relied upon at each decision
Trace relied-upon claims back to anchor points
Assess whether decision would differ with accurate information
Document the cascade from anchor to outcome

sections.title: Case Example
sections.label: Child Removal Decision
sections.content: Final order removing child from parent relied on 5 key findings. Tracing backward: 3 findings originated from anchor points with no independent verification, 1 was based on temporal impossibility, 1 was supported. Without the unverified claims, the threshold for removal would not have been met.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: A SELF contradiction occurs when a single document contradicts itself‚Äîmaking incompatible claims on different pages or in different sections. These often indicate careless compilation, cut-and-paste errors, or attempts to support contradictory conclusions.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Extract all factual claims with document positions
Cross-reference claims within same document
Flag logical incompatibilities (X and not-X)
Identify numeric inconsistencies (different figures for same item)
Detect temporal impossibilities within single narrative

items.title: Page Conflict
items.desc: Report states "no contact since March" on page 3, describes "weekly contact" on page 12.

items.title: Numeric Mismatch
items.desc: Assessment claims 15 sessions occurred, but session log lists only 8 entries.

items.title: Date Impossibility
items.desc: Document states meeting occurred on 15th, but later references "following week's meeting on 18th."

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: INTER_DOC contradictions occur when two or more documents make incompatible claims about the same event, person, or fact. These reveal either errors in one source or deliberate inconsistency across the record.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Extract claims with subject-predicate structure
Match claims across documents by subject entity
Compare predicates for logical compatibility
Assess temporal context (same time period?)
Rank severity based on claim importance

items.title: Agency Conflict
items.desc: Police report: "subject was cooperative." Social work assessment: "subject refused to engage."

items.title: Date Dispute
items.desc: Hospital records show admission on June 3; GP notes reference "hospitalization beginning June 7."

items.title: Witness Variance
items.desc: Statement A: "3 people present." Statement B: "only two of us were there."

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: TEMPORAL contradictions involve dates, sequences, or durations that are logically impossible given other established facts. These often reveal fabrication, poor record-keeping, or fundamental confusion about events.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Extract all temporal references (dates, times, durations)
Build unified timeline from all sources
Check for impossible sequences (effect before cause)
Verify durations sum correctly
Flag references to documents before their creation

items.title: Sequence Violation
items.desc: Report "summarizes" a meeting that occurred three days after report was written.

items.title: Duration Error
items.desc: Claims 6 months of weekly sessions, but date range only spans 14 weeks.

items.title: Reference Paradox
items.desc: Assessment dated March cites "the April psychological evaluation."

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: EVIDENTIARY contradictions occur when claims are presented as factual but lack supporting evidence, or when the cited evidence actually contradicts the claim being made.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Identify claims with factual certainty markers
Locate cited sources and evidence
Verify evidence actually supports the claim
Flag claims with no supporting reference
Detect inverse citations (evidence says opposite)

items.title: Unsupported Fact
items.desc: "The father has a history of violence"‚Äîno incidents, arrests, or evidence cited anywhere in record.

items.title: Inverse Evidence
items.desc: Conclusion cites psychological assessment, but assessment actually reached opposite conclusion.

items.title: Missing Source
items.desc: Report states "according to school records..." but no school records exist in the file.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: MODALITY contradictions track how possibility becomes probability becomes certainty‚Äîwithout new evidence to justify the shift. Watch for hedged language that hardens into factual assertions.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Track claim certainty markers (may, might, possibly ‚Üí likely ‚Üí definitely)
Map certainty changes across documents
Check for new evidence justifying increased certainty
Flag unexplained shifts from hypothesis to fact
Identify where qualifiers are dropped

items.title: Speculation ‚Üí Fact
items.desc: Initial note: "parent may have substance issues." Final report: "history of substance abuse."

items.title: Qualifier Loss
items.desc: Source: "concerns about possible neglect." Citing document: "documented neglect."

items.title: Gradual Hardening
items.desc: Doc 1: "might." Doc 2: "appears to." Doc 3: "clearly." Doc 4: "definitely."

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: SELECTIVE contradictions occur when sources are cited selectively‚Äîomitting context, qualifications, or contradicting passages that would undermine the citing document's conclusions.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Compare cited passages against full source documents
Identify omitted qualifications and context
Flag selective quotation that changes meaning
Calculate bias score (pro/con omission ratio)
Detect pattern of one-sided citation

items.title: Context Removal
items.desc: Quotes "child expressed fear" but omits "in the context of a nightmare about monsters."

items.title: Qualifier Deletion
items.desc: Cites "concerns about attachment" but drops "which appear to be resolving with intervention."

items.title: Contrary Omission
items.desc: Quotes 2 negative paragraphs from report; omits 5 positive paragraphs.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: SCOPE contradictions occur when conclusions exceed the scope of the analysis or when findings are applied beyond their valid domain‚Äîoften when limited assessments support sweeping conclusions.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Extract stated scope and limitations
Compare conclusions against stated scope
Flag recommendations exceeding assessment parameters
Identify extrapolation from limited data
Detect expertise boundary violations

items.title: Assessment Overreach
items.desc: Single 2-hour observation leads to conclusion about "persistent parenting deficits."

items.title: Domain Violation
items.desc: Educational psychologist makes medical diagnostic statements.

items.title: Sample Generalization
items.desc: One witnessed interaction extrapolated to "typical pattern of behavior."

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: UNEXPLAINED contradictions occur when a party changes position without explanation, or when conclusions change without new evidence to justify the change.

sections.title: Detection Algorithm
items: Track position statements by author/entity over time
Identify significant position changes
Search for explanatory evidence between positions
Flag reversals with no documented justification
Detect patterns of strategic position changes

items.title: Sudden Reversal
items.desc: March: "No concerns about care." June: "Significant safeguarding concerns." No new incidents documented.

items.title: Opinion Flip
items.desc: Expert initially recommends reunification; at trial, recommends termination. No new evidence cited.

items.title: Strategic Shift
items.desc: Agency position changes immediately after receiving legal advice‚Äîtiming suggests strategic rather than evidentiary basis.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Entity Resolution engine creates a unified identity registry across your document corpus. It resolves aliases, tracks role changes, and maps relationships between individuals‚Äîessential when the same person appears under different names, titles, or spellings across documents.

sections.title: Capabilities
items: Alias Detection ‚Äî Links "Dr. Smith," "Sarah Smith," "S. Smith," and "the consultant" to the same individual
Role Tracking ‚Äî Follows individuals through position changes (social worker ‚Üí team manager ‚Üí independent expert)
Relationship Mapping ‚Äî Documents who worked with whom, who supervised whom, who referred to whom
Temporal Context ‚Äî Tracks when relationships and roles were active
Conflict Detection ‚Äî Flags potential conflicts of interest in relationship networks

sections.title: Algorithm
sections.content: The engine uses a multi-pass approach: (1) Extract named entities with NLP, (2) Cluster by phonetic similarity and context, (3) Resolve clusters using document proximity and co-reference chains, (4) Build canonical identity with all known aliases, (5) Map relationships from co-occurrence and explicit mentions.

sections.title: Integration
sections.content: Entity Resolution feeds all other engines. Timeline analysis requires knowing who did what when. Contradiction detection needs consistent identity to compare claims. Accountability mapping requires clear attribution of actions to individuals.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Temporal Parser constructs unified timelines from scattered date references across your documents. It identifies gaps, detects impossible sequences, and flags temporal anomalies that indicate error or manipulation.

sections.title: Capabilities
items: Date Extraction ‚Äî Parses varied formats: "15 March 2023," "3/15/23," "mid-March," "the following week"
Timeline Construction ‚Äî Builds unified chronology from all documents
Gap Detection ‚Äî Identifies missing periods with no documented activity
Sequence Validation ‚Äî Checks that cause precedes effect, meetings happen before minutes
Deadline Tracking ‚Äî Monitors statutory timeframes and flags breaches

sections.title: Algorithm
sections.content: The engine: (1) Extracts all temporal expressions with context, (2) Normalizes to ISO 8601 format with confidence scores, (3) Links events to their temporal anchors, (4) Builds event sequence graphs, (5) Validates against logical constraints, (6) Computes gap significance based on expected activity density.

sections.title: Sample Output
sections.label: Anomaly Detection
sections.content: TEMPORAL ANOMALY: Assessment dated 12.03.2024 references psychological evaluation dated 28.03.2024 (16 days in future). Confidence: HIGH. Possible explanations: dating error, document backdating, or fabrication.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Argumentation engine deconstructs claims into their logical components using the Toulmin model. It identifies what's being claimed, what evidence supports it, what assumptions link evidence to claim, and what would rebut the argument.

items.title: Claim
items.desc: The conclusion or assertion being made

items.title: Grounds
items.desc: The evidence or facts supporting the claim

items.title: Warrant
items.desc: The logical principle connecting grounds to claim

items.title: Backing
items.desc: Support for the warrant itself

items.title: Qualifier
items.desc: Degree of certainty (probably, certainly, possibly)

items.title: Rebuttal
items.desc: Conditions that would defeat the argument

sections.title: Analysis Functions
items: Claim Extraction ‚Äî Identifies assertions requiring support
Warrant Analysis ‚Äî Evaluates whether the logical connection is valid
Gap Detection ‚Äî Finds claims with missing grounds or implicit warrants
Rebuttal Mapping ‚Äî Identifies evidence that undermines claims
Strength Scoring ‚Äî Rates argument quality from evidence to claim

sections.title: Sample Output
sections.label: Argument Deconstruction
sections.content:
CLAIM: "Child is at risk of significant harm."
GROUNDS: Single anonymous referral allegation.
WARRANT: Implied‚Äîallegations indicate actual risk.
BACKING: None provided.
QUALIFIER: Stated as certain.
REBUTTAL: No investigation conducted; allegation unverified.
STRENGTH SCORE: 0.23/1.0 (WEAK)

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Bias Detection engine performs statistical analysis of directional bias in reporting. It calculates omission ratios, measures framing imbalance, and quantifies whether information is being presented selectively to support a particular conclusion.

items.title: Directional Bias Score
items.desc: Range -1.0 to +1.0. Measures which direction omissions favor.

items.title: Framing Ratio
items.desc: Compares space/time given to different perspectives.

items.title: Omission Rate
items.desc: Percentage of source material excluded in citations.

items.title: Selection Bias
items.desc: Whether included/excluded items show systematic pattern.

sections.title: Calculation Method
sections.content:
Directional Bias Score = (Pro-X omissions - Pro-Y omissions) / Total omissions

A score of +1.0 means 100% of omissions favor one direction. A score of 0 indicates balanced omissions. The engine identifies what was omitted and whether omissions show a pattern.

sections.title: Sample Output
sections.label: Documentary Analysis
sections.content: BIAS ANALYSIS: 8 material omissions identified. Pro-prosecution: 8. Pro-defense: 0. Directional Score: +1.0 (maximum prosecution bias). Framing ratio: 13.2:1 (suspect framing vs. exculpatory context). Statistical significance: p < 0.00001.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Contradiction engine systematically detects inconsistencies across your document corpus using the CASCADE 8-type framework. It surfaces conflicts that undermine institutional conclusions and maps where the record disagrees with itself.

sections.title: CASCADE Integration
items: SELF ‚Äî Scans each document for internal contradictions
INTER_DOC ‚Äî Cross-references claims across documents
TEMPORAL ‚Äî Validates timeline consistency
EVIDENTIARY ‚Äî Checks claims against cited evidence
MODALITY ‚Äî Tracks certainty shifts without justification
SELECTIVE ‚Äî Compares citations against full sources
SCOPE ‚Äî Validates conclusions stay within stated limits
UNEXPLAINED ‚Äî Flags position changes without rationale

sections.title: Confidence Scoring
sections.content: Each contradiction is scored for confidence (certainty it's a real conflict) and severity (impact on conclusions). High-confidence, high-severity contradictions are prioritized for review. The engine provides specific document locations and suggested explanations.

sections.title: Sample Output
sections.label: Contradiction Finding
sections.content:
INTER_DOC CONTRADICTION
Doc A (Police Report, pg 3): "Subject fully cooperative with investigation."
Doc B (Social Work Assessment, pg 7): "Subject refused to engage with authorities."
Same time period, same events. Confidence: HIGH. Severity: HIGH.
Implication: One account is inaccurate. Investigate which report is correct.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The Accountability engine maps statutory duty violations to specific actors and regulatory bodies. It links evidence to relevant professional standards, identifies breach points, and routes findings to appropriate complaint pathways.

sections.title: Capabilities
items: Duty Identification ‚Äî Maps relevant statutory and professional duties to each actor
Breach Detection ‚Äî Identifies where actions violated duties
Actor Attribution ‚Äî Links violations to specific individuals
Regulatory Routing ‚Äî Matches breaches to appropriate bodies (Ofcom, ICO, HCPC, etc.)
Evidence Packaging ‚Äî Organizes evidence for complaint submission

items.title: Ofcom
items.desc: Broadcasting Code violations (Sections 5, 7, 8)

items.title: ICO
items.desc: UK GDPR breaches (Articles 6, 7, 9, 17, 21)

items.title: HCPC
items.desc: Social work and health professional standards

items.title: LGO
items.desc: Local government maladministration

items.title: NMC
items.desc: Nursing and midwifery conduct

items.title: SRA
items.desc: Solicitor conduct and ethics

sections.title: Sample Output
sections.label: Accountability Finding
sections.content:
ACTOR: Simon Ford (Channel 4 Executive)
DUTY: Ofcom Code Section 7.1 (Privacy)
BREACH: Proceeded with broadcast despite 12+ documented consent refusals
EVIDENCE: E3.4 (meeting transcript), E3.5 (written objection), E3.6 (false consent claim)
RECOMMENDED ACTION: Ofcom complaint under Section 7

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: Medical records are notoriously fragmented and contradictory. A single patient file can contain thousands of pages from multiple providers. Phronesis helps you reconstruct the actual timeline of care and identify discrepancies between what was documented and what actually happened.

sections.title: Key Capabilities
items: Timeline Reconstruction ‚Äî Merge nurse notes, doctor orders, and machine logs into one chronology
Contradiction Detection ‚Äî Flag when the discharge summary contradicts the daily progress notes
Staff Tracking ‚Äî Map exactly who was involved at critical moments
Gap Analysis ‚Äî Identify missing records or unexplained time periods

sections.title: Real-World Application
sections.label: Wrongful Death Case
sections.content: Hospital claimed patient was monitored every 15 minutes. Phronesis timeline showed 4-hour gap in vital sign logs and contradictions between nursing staff regarding who was responsible.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: Reporting misconduct is dangerous. You need airtight evidence, but you can't risk uploading sensitive documents to cloud tools. Phronesis allows you to build a comprehensive evidence package entirely on your own device, ensuring maximum security and privacy.

sections.title: Key Capabilities
items: Local-First Security ‚Äî Zero data leaves your machine; no cloud logs
Pattern Recognition ‚Äî Connect isolated incidents into a systemic pattern
Duty Mapping ‚Äî Link specific actions to breached regulations or laws
Anonymized Export ‚Äî Generate reports that focus on facts, not just your testimony

sections.title: Real-World Application
sections.label: Corporate Fraud
sections.content: Employee identified 12 distinct instances of falsified safety reports over 18 months. Phronesis mapped the approvals to a single manager who had denied knowledge.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: Representing yourself in court puts you at a disadvantage against professional legal teams. Phronesis levels the playing field by giving you the same analytical power they have. Organize your evidence, find holes in their story, and present professional-grade chronologies.

sections.title: Key Capabilities
items: Evidence Organization ‚Äî Sort hundreds of PDFs by date, type, and relevance
Cross-Examination Prep ‚Äî Find every prior statement a witness has made to identify inconsistencies
Professional Output ‚Äî Generate clear, cited timelines for judges
Cost Savings ‚Äî Do the heavy lifting yourself instead of paying hourly legal rates

sections.title: Real-World Application
sections.label: Family Court
sections.content: Parent successfully challenged a biased assessment by using Phronesis to list 23 factual errors and contradictions in the social worker's report, citing source documents for each.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: You've obtained 500 documents from a FOIA request about a government agency's handling of safety complaints. Manual review would take weeks and likely miss key connections. Phronesis processes the corpus, builds entity networks, constructs timelines, and surfaces contradictions‚Äîgiving you leads in hours.

sections.title: Typical Workflow
items: Ingest document dump with automatic OCR and text extraction
Build entity registry linking all referenced individuals and organizations
Construct unified timeline from scattered date references
Run contradiction detection across full corpus
Generate bias analysis on key reports
Export findings with full citation chains for fact-checking

items.title: Hidden Connections
items.desc: Entity mapping reveals undisclosed relationships between officials and contractors.

items.title: Timeline Gaps
items.desc: Temporal analysis shows 3-month period with no documented activity‚Äîsuspicious silence.

items.title: Selective Reporting
items.desc: Bias detection shows internal reports consistently omit negative outcomes.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: You're preparing for trial with 1,200 pages of discovery documents. The opposing party's witness statements need systematic analysis for contradictions. Expert reports need comparison against source materials. Phronesis builds your cross-examination materials automatically.

sections.title: Typical Workflow
items: Import case file with document categorization
Run entity resolution to track all witnesses and experts
Build timeline from all date references
Cross-reference witness statements for contradictions
Analyze expert reports against cited sources
Generate Toulmin structure analysis of opposing arguments

items.title: Deposition Prep
items.desc: Contradiction report shows witness gave inconsistent accounts across 4 statements.

items.title: Expert Challenge
items.desc: Analysis reveals expert's conclusions exceed scope of their assessment.

items.title: Timeline Defense
items.desc: Temporal parsing proves alibi with date cross-references opposing counsel missed.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: Your organization handles 50+ cases per year involving the same government agency. You suspect systemic problems but lack the bandwidth to document patterns across cases. Phronesis enables cross-case analysis to identify institutional failures that repeat.

sections.title: Typical Workflow
items: Create case corpus spanning multiple matters
Build entity registry linking agency staff across cases
Run accountability analysis on each case
Aggregate findings to identify repeat patterns
Generate regulatory complaint templates with cross-case evidence
Document statistical significance of patterns

items.title: Pattern Recognition
items.desc: Same procedural violation appears in 60% of cases‚Äîsystemic not individual.

items.title: Actor Tracking
items.desc: One supervisor appears in 15 cases with consistent duty breaches.

items.title: Regulatory Impact
items.desc: Cross-case evidence package leads to formal investigation of agency practices.

sections.title: Workflow Scenario
sections.content: You're researching how child protection decisions are made across 200 case files. Traditional qualitative coding would take months. Phronesis enables systematic analysis with reproducible methodology‚Äîextracting patterns, building taxonomies, and documenting institutional behavior at scale.

sections.title: Typical Workflow
items: Ingest research corpus with anonymization
Apply consistent analytical framework (S.A.M.) across all cases
Extract coded data points for quantitative analysis
Build entity and relationship networks
Identify claim propagation patterns
Export structured data for statistical analysis

items.title: Reproducibility
items.desc: Systematic methodology enables other researchers to replicate findings.

items.title: Scale
items.desc: Analyze 10x more cases than traditional qualitative methods allow.

items.title: Pattern Discovery
items.desc: Computational analysis reveals patterns human coders consistently miss.

sections.title: Vision
sections.content:
Aletheia applies the same forensic rigor Phronesis brings to institutional documents to the chaotic world of political media. It's not another news aggregator‚Äîit's a forensic analysis tool for political discourse.

Analyze anyone: news outlets, YouTubers, influencers, political figures, or citizen journalists. Track their claims over time, measure their accuracy, and understand their rhetorical patterns.

sections.title: Key Differentiators
items: Source Agnostic ‚Äî Analyze mainstream media, alternative media, social platforms, podcasts
Claim Database ‚Äî Persistent tracking of factual claims with verification status
Cross-Source Comparison ‚Äî See how different sources cover the same events
Historical Accuracy ‚Äî Track prediction and claim accuracy over time
Narrative Archaeology ‚Äî Trace how stories evolve and mutate

items.title: YouTube Analysis
items.desc: Transcript extraction, claim identification, source verification for video content.

items.title: Twitter/X Monitoring
items.desc: Thread analysis, claim tracking, engagement pattern analysis.

items.title: Podcast Support
items.desc: Audio transcription and claim extraction from spoken content.

items.title: Influencer Profiles
items.desc: Accuracy scores, rhetorical patterns, topic focus areas.

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Aletheia is in concept development. I am validating the core analysis approach and building partnerships with researchers studying media ecosystems. If you're interested in early access or collaboration, get in touch.

sections.title: Vision
sections.content:
Nous inverts the paradigm of every productivity tool: instead of learning its structure before doing useful work, you simply describe what you want to understand. The system algorithmically builds the right analytical approach for your goal.

Structure emerges from purpose, not templates. No databases to configure, no properties to define, no schemas to learn.

sections.title: Key Differentiators
items: Zero Setup ‚Äî Start analyzing immediately, structure materializes as needed
Intent-First ‚Äî Describe goals in natural language, system designs the approach
Adaptive Pipelines ‚Äî Analysis methodology customized to your specific question
Persistent Understanding ‚Äî Insights compound across sessions, not lost to context limits
Transparent Methodology ‚Äî See how analysis works, adjust mid-stream

items.title: Question Mode
items.desc: Ask a specific question. System designs analysis to answer it.

items.title: Goal Mode
items.desc: State what you want to understand. System identifies what to analyze.

items.title: Explorer Mode
items.desc: Point at data. System surfaces what's interesting.

items.title: Verification Mode
items.desc: State a hypothesis. System designs test.

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Nous is a long-term vision product. The core concepts inform the approach to Phronesis development, but Nous as a standalone product is in early research phase. I am exploring how to make sophisticated analysis accessible without requiring expertise in analytical methodology.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: For researchers who live in Obsidian, Phronesis integrates directly with your vault. Findings sync automatically, entities become linked notes, and your analysis becomes part of your knowledge graph.

sections.title: Planned Features
items: Vault Sync ‚Äî Bidirectional sync between Phronesis and your Obsidian vault
Wikilinks ‚Äî Entities automatically linked with [[wikilink]] syntax
YAML Frontmatter ‚Äî Structured metadata for notes
Template Integration ‚Äî Custom templates for different finding types
Graph Visualization ‚Äî See entity relationships in Obsidian graph view

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: The Obsidian plugin is in active development. Basic vault sync and wikilink generation are working. I am building more sophisticated two-way sync and template support.

roadmap-mcp.title: MCP Server
roadmap-mcp.subtitle: Claude Integration via Model Context Protocol

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The MCP (Model Context Protocol) server enables Claude and other AI assistants to directly query your Phronesis database and run forensic operations. Your analysis becomes accessible to AI tools while maintaining local-first principles.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: Database Queries ‚Äî Claude can search your document corpus
Engine Invocation ‚Äî Trigger analysis engines from Claude
Finding Retrieval ‚Äî Access contradiction and bias findings
Entity Lookup ‚Äî Query the entity resolution database
Timeline Access ‚Äî Retrieve constructed timelines

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: The MCP server is in active development. Core tool definitions are implemented and basic queries work. I am expanding capability coverage and optimizing response formats for AI consumption.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Compare any document against its source materials to identify what was excluded. Calculate directional bias scores and map selective citation patterns systematically.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: Source Alignment ‚Äî Map report sections to source documents
Gap Identification ‚Äî Identify source content not included in reports
Bias Scoring ‚Äî Calculate directional bias from omission patterns
Context Analysis ‚Äî Identify when omitted context changes meaning
Pattern Detection ‚Äî Find systematic omission tendencies

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Omission detection is next priority after current engine stabilization. The bias detection engine provides foundation‚Äîomission detection extends it with source comparison capabilities.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Evaluate expert reports against professional standards. Check FJC compliance, assess scope boundaries, and identify opinions that exceed expertise or overstep appropriate limits.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: FJC Compliance ‚Äî Check against Federal Judicial Center guidelines
Scope Analysis ‚Äî Validate conclusions stay within stated scope
Expertise Mapping ‚Äî Verify opinions within stated expertise
Methodology Review ‚Äî Assess described methodology
Standard Comparison ‚Äî Check against professional body standards

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Expert witness analysis is planned for implementation after omission detection. Core argumentation engine provides foundation for claim analysis.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Compare broadcast or published content against source materials. Quantify what was included versus omitted and measure editorial bias in framing choices.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: Transcript Alignment ‚Äî Match broadcast content to source materials
Framing Analysis ‚Äî Measure time/space allocation between perspectives
Omission Mapping ‚Äî Identify source content not included
Context Comparison ‚Äî Check if quotes are used in original context
Bias Quantification ‚Äî Statistical measure of editorial choices

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Documentary analysis is planned. I am developing this capability in response to specific case needs involving broadcast media accountability.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Detect hidden coordination between supposedly independent agencies. Identify shared language, circular citations, and pre-disclosure information flow that indicates coordinated rather than independent decision-making.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: Language Fingerprinting ‚Äî Detect shared phrasing across institutions
Citation Network Analysis ‚Äî Map circular reference patterns
Timeline Correlation ‚Äî Identify suspicious timing patterns
Information Flow Tracking ‚Äî Trace how information moves between agencies
Independence Validation ‚Äî Test whether decisions were truly independent

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Cross-institutional mapping is planned. This capability builds on entity resolution and temporal parsing to detect coordination patterns.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Capture documents on the go and sync to your desktop instance. Take photos of physical documents and queue them for processing when you return.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: Document Capture ‚Äî Camera-based document scanning
Offline Queue ‚Äî Store captures until desktop sync
Quick Notes ‚Äî Add annotations to captured documents
Secure Sync ‚Äî Encrypted transfer to desktop instance
Push Status ‚Äî Notifications when processing completes

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Mobile companion is in research phase. I am exploring mobile development frameworks and sync architecture that maintain local-first principles.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: RESTful API for integrating Phronesis analysis capabilities into your own applications. Build custom workflows and connect to existing systems.

sections.title: Planned Capabilities
items: REST Endpoints ‚Äî Standard HTTP API for all operations
Webhooks ‚Äî Push notifications for analysis completion
SDK Libraries ‚Äî Python, TypeScript, and Rust clients
Authentication ‚Äî API key and OAuth support
Rate Limiting ‚Äî Configurable limits for shared instances

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Developer API is in research phase. I am designing API contracts and considering authentication approaches that respect local-first principles.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Optional cloud sync for teams working on the same case. Maintain local-first principles with encrypted, opt-in collaboration features.

sections.title: Planned Features
items: E2E Encryption ‚Äî Zero-knowledge sync‚Äîthe server can't read your data
Role Permissions ‚Äî Control who can view, edit, and administer
Audit Logs ‚Äî Track all access and modifications
Conflict Resolution ‚Äî Handle simultaneous edits gracefully
Selective Sharing ‚Äî Share specific cases, not entire database

sections.title: Development Status
sections.content: Team collaboration is in research phase. I am exploring encryption approaches and sync architectures that preserve local-first principles while enabling collaboration.
